issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Is not a bug in our product
resolution.name: Not Our Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I am trying to test Firebase Crashlytics by cause both an exception and a null variable crash.

If I use a module and crash the app inside there, the app closes. 
However, if I crash it in titanium, I get an application error without the closing of the app.

What is going on.
fields.summary: Trying to crash the app like in native code

comments.body:
The error handler catches those kind of actions so they won't actually crash the app. You might be able to pull it off using Hyperloop or creating your own memory leak though. 

Closing the issue as this is not a request but more a "how to" question.I'd recommend joining [TiSlack|https://tislack.org] to get community support where you can easily ask questions like this
